short_summary:
The department of fisheries and oceans has a requirement for
prototyping innovative solutions to modernize the electronic monitoring program
description: The solutions should leverage artificial intelligence to provide high-quality catch information, to create an efficiency in the electronic monitoring data workflows, and to minimize the costs. The main goal  is to evaluate the idoneity of using AI on fishery system monitoring
full_summary:
* **Title**: Electronic Monitoring Solution for Commercial Fisheries
* **Tender Number**: WS3744871201-Doc3753072974
* **Publication Date**: November 22, 2022
* **Closing Date**: January 20, 2023, 2:00 PM (EST)
* **Notice Type**: Request for Proposal (RFP)
* **Method of Procurement**: Invitation to Tender (ITT)
* **Procurement Category**: Services
* **trade Agreements**: This tender is subject to the Canada-UK Trade Continuity Agreement, the Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement, the Canadian Free Trade Agreement, the Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement, the World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement, the North American Free Trade Agreement, the Canada-Ukraine Free Trade Agreement, the Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement, the Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement, the Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement, the Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement, and the Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement.
* **Solicitation Method**: Competitive Selective Tendering
* **Evaluation Criteria**: Combined rating of technical merits and price
* **Regions of Opportunity**: National Capital Region (NCR)
* **Regions of Delivery**: The contract will cover the National Capital Region (NCR).
* **Contracting Entity**: Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
* **Contracting Entity Address**: 11 Laurier Street, Phase III, Place du Portage, Gatineau, Quebec, K1A 0S5, Canada
* **End User Entities**: Department of Fisheries and Oceans (DFO)
* **End User Entities Address**: 200 Kent Street, Ottawa, Ontario, K1A 0E6, Canada
* **Contact Information**: Scott Endicott at scott.endicott@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca
* **Notice URL**: <http://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/14654019?extsite=MTQ2NTQwMTlfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==>

**Tender Description**:
The Department of Fisheries and Oceans (DFO) Canada requires a solution to modernize its electronic monitoring program for commercial fisheries. The proposed solution should leverage advanced technologies, such as Artificial Intelligence (AI), to provide high-quality catch information, improve data workflows, and minimize associated costs.
